title: Long-run economic growth shown in AD-AS graph

content.question: If AD and AS represent aggregate demand and aggregate supply curves, respectively, and the arrows indicate the movement of the curves, which of the following graphs best illustrates long-run economic growth?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph in the first quadrant with price level on the vertical axis and real gross domestic product on the horizontal axis. Choice A has two parallel curves that start in the upper left and are decreasing and concave up, with the upper curve labeled A D sub 1 and the lower curve labeled A D sub 2. An arrow points down and to the left from A D sub 1 to A D sub 2. A third curve labeled A S starts in the lower left and is increasing and concave up, intersecting the two other curves.

Choice B is a graph in the first quadrant with price level on the vertical axis and real gross domestic product on the horizontal axis. Choice B has two parallel curves that start in the lower left and are increasing and concave up, with the upper curve labeled A S sub 2 and the lower curve labeled A S sub 1. An arrow points to the left from A S sub 1 to A S sub 2. A third curve labeled A D starts in the upper left and is decreasing and concave up, intersecting the two other curves.

Choice C is a graph in the first quadrant with price level on the vertical axis and real gross domestic product on the horizontal axis.  Choice C has two vertical lines that start on the horizontal axis with the line on the left labeled A S sub 1 and the line on the right labeled A S sub 2. An arrow points to the left from A S sub 2 to A S sub 1. A curve labeled A D starts in the upper left and is decreasing and concave up, intersecting the two lines.

Choice D is a graph in the first quadrant with price level on the vertical axis and real gross domestic product on the horizontal axis. Choice D has two vertical lines that start on the horizontal axis with the line on the left labeled A S sub 1 and the line on the right labeled A S sub 2. An arrow points to the right from A S sub 1 to A S sub 2. A curve labeled A D starts in the upper left and is decreasing and concave up, intersecting the two lines.

Choice E is a graph in the first quadrant with price level on the vertical axis and real gross domestic product on the horizontal axis. Choice E has two parallel curves that start in the upper left and are decreasing and concave up, with the upper curve labeled A D sub 2 and the lower curve labeled A D sub 1. An arrow points up and to the right from A D sub 1 to A D sub 2. A third curve labeled A S starts in the lower left and is increasing and concave up, intersecting the two other curves.

content.answer: Choice D is a graph in the first quadrant with price level on the vertical axis and real gross domestic product on the horizontal axis. Choice D has two vertical lines that start on the horizontal axis with the line on the left labeled A S sub 1 and the line on the right labeled A S sub 2. An arrow points to the right from A S sub 1 to A S sub 2. A curve labeled A D starts in the upper left and is decreasing and concave up, intersecting the two lines.
